subject: Re: JUnit Anti-patterns
msgSnippet: ... Thanks Andrew. That s a good example. I ll add them in. Cheers, Joe
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Andrew McDonagh <yahoogroups@...> wrote:
>
> Joe Schmetzer wrote:
>
> >I've just updated the JUnit Anti-patterns page I maintain at
> >http://www.exubero.com/junit/antipatterns.html. I'd be interested in
> >any feedback, if people want to suggest additions or improvements.
> >
> >Cheers,
> >Joe
> >
> >
> >
>
> Good start...one to add off the top of my head...
>
> Using the wrong assertXxxx
>
> Example
>
> assertTrue("errmm they dont match", obj1.equals(obj2));
>
> assertTrue("Wrong number of widgets", obj1.getWidgetsCount() != 10);
>
> Replace with AssertEquals
>
> assertEquals("errmm they dont match", obj1, obj2);
>
> assertEquals("Wrong number of widgets", 10, obj1.getWidgetsCount() );
>

Thanks Andrew. That's a good example. I'll add them in.

Cheers,
Joe
